incidents.name: reCAPTCHA in Sign up forms for Marketing showing "Invalid domain for site key" error

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We are still working toward a fix for existing signup forms. New signup forms are now working. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 11:58 AM PT on January 13th, our engineers began investigating an issue with reCAPTCHA displaying an "Invalid domain for site key" error on New Marketing Campaigns Signup Forms. Due to this issue, end users of the forms are currently unable to submit form entries. This does not impact mail send. We've identified the cause, and we're actively working on a fix. We will provide another update as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. Users might still experience errors at this time. We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 6:48a PT on Dec. 14th, our engineers began investigating an issue with Legacy Marketing Campaigns. Users may experience the error "Your campaign could not be created, please try again in a few moments" when creating a Legacy Marketing campaign. Additionally, some customers are encountering issues when adding or searching for legacy marketing contacts. This does not impact the mail send API. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 1:31 PM PT on 12-11-2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with Marketing Campaigns segments and Single Sends triggering to these segments. A subset of customers using segmentation may experience errors while trying to send emails such as Automations or Single Sends to these specific segments. This does not impact the mail send API. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Starting around 01:23 PM PST on 12-04-2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with mail send. Few customers may have experienced the following error ‘We cannot allow you to access SendGrid because you appear to be located in an embargoed region' when trying to send emails. Our engineers are implementing a fix and are monitoring system performance.

incidents.name: Links in emails resulting in 'Site can't be reached' error.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have concluded the monitoring status and now all services are back to normal. Links can now be accessed. This incident is officially resolved.
Our engineers have applied a fix and are currently monitoring the results of all services. We'll be monitoring the fix and provide more updates as soon as they become available.
We are continuing to investigate this issue, our engineers are actively looking to understand the root cause and we will be providing updates as soon as they become available.

Starting around 3 AM on 22nd November, 2024 our engineers began investigating an issue with clicking SSL click tracked links in emails wherein the recipients are receiving 500 Origin Error. The origin server is not reachable or returns an error.

The issue has only been observed so far for customers using KeyCDN for their SSL click tracking configuration.

Our team is actively working to identify the root cause and will provide updates within the next hour or as new information becomes available.

incidents.name: Click Tracking degradation

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with click tracking has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

As of approximately 1:30 AM PST on Thursday, November 21, 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue impacting Click Tracking URLs using 'ct.sendgrid.net'.

This issue affects customers who have enabled click tracking but have not configured link branding.

This does not affect mail send.

Our team is actively working to identify the root cause and will provide updates within the next hour or as new information becomes available.

incidents.name: Intermmittent login issues after adding credentials

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. All systems are operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have applied a fix and are monitoring the results, we will provide an update in an hour or as soon as more updates become available

Starting 6:43 AM PT (exact time will be determined soon), our engineers began investigating issues when accessing the account using credentials as username and password. When adding the right credentials, users receive an error of 'Your username or password is invalid'. 

This is only affecting password users, meaning that SSO users are not affected.

This does not affect mail send.

Customers seem to have success accessing the account by retrying again or using an incognito window. Our engineers are currently investigating the current behavior and will provide an update within an hour or as soon as they become available.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Starting around 1:00 PM PST on Saturday, November 16th, 2024, our Engineers began investigating an issue with SendGrid Events. Customers may experience delays with Event reporting associated to mail send. The issue is causing intermittent errors and delays on Events (webhook, open and click events, Stats and Email Activity Feed events). This does not impact mail send. We are actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Intermittent timeouts when trying to login to the SendGrid console

incident_updates.body: SendGrid engineers monitoring the environment have seen no further timeout errors in the logs. As a result this incident is being resolved at 1:03pst.

SendGrid engineers have found the cause and implemented a permanent fix for the timeout errors, and are now monitoring to ensure that everything is working and that timeouts do not begin to occur again.

We will follow up with an update in one hour or sooner if we have new information.

SendGrid engineers are continuing to investigate the issue and explore a permanent fix for the timeouts. The issue is still mitigated for new users with a temporary fix. We will follow up with more information in one hour or as soon as we have another update.

SendGrid engineers have found a temporary fix, and the issue is currently mitigated for users and any new attempts to login. We are continuing to investigate the root cause and work towards a solution. We we follow up in 1 hour or sooner if we have more information.

Beginning around 7:30am PST SendGrid engineers noticed intermittent timeouts for some users when trying to login to the SendGrid console or UI. There is no impact to mail send, and the API is available as a workaround. If you experience a timeout error, you may also be able to successfully login on future attempts. We are still investigating, and will follow up in 1 hour or sooner if we have more information.

Our engineers are continue to monitor system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

The emails that are deferred are being retried and successfully delivering. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more updates become available.

SendGrid engineers are actively investigating the issue. Email sends may experience an increase in email deferrals; however, there is currently no loss of emails being observed. The emails that are deferred are being retried and successfully delivering. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more updates become available.

Starting around 5.15 AM PST, October 25th, our engineers began investigating issues with the SendGrid delivery platform where some users were affected by multiple deferrals under the reason 'Internal server error' and similar errors that prevented emails from being delivered.

Issue has been identified and a fix has been deployed. We are monitoring the last errors since and will update on the impact. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more updates become available.

incidents.name: Non-Unified Account Email Address Change Notifications Not Sending

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved an issue with Email Address Change Notifications not sending. This issue only affected accounts not Unified with Twilio. From Sept 19th at 1:24PM PT to Sept 23rd at 12:10PM PT, customers leveraging non-Unified accounts may not have received email address change verification emails. Any requested email changes made by these accounts during this window would need to be re-triggered on the user end. The issue has been resolved, and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Issues with Domain Authentication

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Domain authentication has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

A fix has been implemented by the third party provider. We are currently monitoring our system while the provider processes the authentication requests submitted earlier. It will take a few hours for all pending requests to be processed. We will provide another update in two hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 10:07 AM PDT on Wednesday, 09/18/2024, our Engineers identified an issue impacting new domain authentications. Due to a third-party provider, customers won't be able to authenticate new domains despite the DNS records being correctly added on their side, and won't be able to send emails on behalf of those domains until the authentication is complete. This issue doesn't affect the domains that have been authenticated and therefore, it doesn't impact email sending for them. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Unrecognized 2FA codes prevented login to SendGrid accounts

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved an issue preventing access to the SendGrid UI. From 10:45 AM PST to 11:50 AM PST customers accessing the legacy SendGrid UI may not have been able to log into their consoles as 2FA verification codes via SMS or Authy app were not recognized. Unified accounts were not affected by the situation. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Mail Delivery Delays in Asia Pacific Region

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with mail delivery delays has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time, so we'll close this incident to Resolved. Thank you for your understanding.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance, we are seeing an improved performance overall and all messages are now being delivered without any delay. We will provide another update within the next minutes once we can confirm the issue has been resolved correctly.

Our engineers have identified the root cause of the issue and continue testing possible fixes. At this time, customers could have experienced delays in Asia Pacific mail send requests from 1:24 am PT to 2:06am. New traffic continues to be swung away from Asia Pacific, and we do not expect delays to new mail sends after 2:06am PT. The stuck mails were all delivered by 6:12am PDT. Additionally, we identified another impact for degraded mail send API availability from 1:24am PDT to 2:52am PDT. It's mitigated by further swinging traffic away from Oceania at 2:48am PDT

We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineering team have identified mail delivery delays occurring in the Asia Pacific region. We are actively working to resolve. As a result, these emails may experience extended delivery times. We will continue to monitor the situation and provide updates while we work to clear the backlog.

incidents.name: Customers received incorrect usage alert emails

incident_updates.body: On 8/28/24, some customers were sent emails that incorrect stated usage was over the daily limit and in some cases over 100% of the daily limit. We identified the cause of the issue and have corrected it so future usage alerts will be correct. No emails were sent in error from impacted accounts, and emails can still be sent as long as the account is under its daily/ monthly limit.

incidents.name: Missing Category Stats between July 25th and July 30th

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the missing category statistics have been properly and accurately restored. All statistics are now displaying normally at this time.

Our engineers confirmed that the deployed fix to restore any missing category stats between the dates of July 25th and July 30th is complete. We will monitor the results of this deploy over the next 30 minutes to ensure proper restoration of missing category statistics for the period at which point another update will be given.

Our engineers have identified the work needed to restore missing category stats between the dates of July 25th and July 30th. The work needed to complete restoration during this period is anticipated to require several hours for the internal SendGrid system to properly backfill the missing statistics.  Once the data is fully and accurately backfilled for the period, another update will be provided via this status post. Thank you for your patience.

Our engineers are continuing to work towards a fix for missing category stats from the dates of July 25th to July 30th. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SendGrid Platform Unavailability

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored system performance and confirmed the issue with Mail Send and Statistics between the period of 7:40 AM PDT and 8:54 AM PDT has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineering teams are continuing to monitor system performance. We will provide an update in 3 hours, or as soon as more information is available.
Our engineering teams are continuing to monitor system performance. We will provide an update in 2 hours, or as soon as more information is available.

At 1:01 PM PDT, our engineering team confirmed that all delayed events between the period of 7:40 AM PDT and 8:54 AM PDT for mail send and statistics were fully dequeued and processed successfully. Another update will be provided in the next 30 minutes in order to confirm full recovery and stability of the SendGrid platform.

At this time, our engineers have confirmed to have mitigated the majority of impact for degraded components. The impact time window is confirmed to have started at approximately 7:40 AM PDT. At 8:08 AM PDT, our engineering team deployed a change to mitigate degraded components. At 8:54 AM PDT, our team confirmed that this same deploy was fully in effect and allowed any new mail send and statistics to process properly from that time. However, mail send and statistics requests that were requested, scheduled or deferred between the times of 7:40 AM PDT and 8:54 AM PDT may still be impacted with delays until further notice. New mail send requests, Marketing Campaigns usage, SendGrid API and UI usage, statistics retrieval and email activity usage after 8:54 AM PDT is confirmed to be working as expected and fully functional. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as possible.

Our engineers have identified the problems related to platform unavailability and problems will continue to be explored for resolution. Currently, users of the SendGrid system may experience delays in requested mail send, errors when using Marketing Campaigns, errors when using the SendGrid API and user interface, as well as delays in retrieval of statistics. This incident does impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as possible.

Our engineers are still investigating various issues reported and known to be impacting the SendGrid platform. At this time, users of the SendGrid system may continue to experience issues using both the API and web console interface. We will continue to investigate and provide further details as they become known. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as possible.

Starting around 7:45 AM PDT on August 15th, our engineers began investigating issues with the SendGrid platform. As of now, users will experience issues logging into the platform and accessing the user interface. Other errors may be present. We are continuing to investigate the full scope of the issue and will update impact. We will provide another update in 60 minutes or as soon as more updates become available.

incidents.name: Legacy Marketing Campaigns Maintenance: Saturday, August 10, 4pm to 5pm Pacific Time (PT)

incident_updates.body: The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

In order to increase the stability and scalability of our systems, we are performing maintenance on Legacy Marketing Campaigns on August 10, from 4pm to 5pm Pacific Time (PT). During this time, customers may experience errors while creating and editing campaigns and contacts. This Maintenance only impacts users using Legacy Marketing Campaigns.

incidents.name: Subuser Management IP Assignment User Interface Errors

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed that the aforementioned subuser management problems have been resolved. This incident did not impact mail send. All services are now operating normally at this time.
At 11:31 AM PDT, our engineers deployed a change as a means to resolve the issue. The deployed change will be monitored over the next 30 minutes at which point another update will be provided.

Around 10:40 AM PDT, our engineers identified the root cause of the errors and are working towards deploying a fix. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting at 10:05 AM PDT, our engineers began investigating an issue in which assigning of IP addresses for outbound mail send to sub users within "Settings > Subuser Management" within the user interface results in errors.  Errors may include a red banner message stating "not found in the request body".  Additionally, intermittent errors may include inaccurate assignment of IP addresses when clicking "change sending" and selecting IP addresses for a designated sub user to utilize. This does not directly impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are aware of this issue and our engineers are working towards a fix, we will provide another update in 1 hour, or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Teammate Management and Sign-In Resulting in Errors

incident_updates.body:
Our engineers have monitored the stability of the deployment to the SendGrid platform and have confirmed that no new teammate errors are present. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Teammates who have not linked to Twilio through the Unified Login feature would not be impacted. If you have linked a teammate, do not make changes to the teammate's profile or permissions as they will be unable to properly login to SendGrid. You can resolve this for impacted teammates by deleting and recreating the impacted teammate using the same email address. 

Please reach out to our Support Team for any further questions or issues not resolved by deleting and recreating.

At 3:04 PM PDT, our engineering team deployed a fix to mitigate more unexpected errors related to signing in with teammates, adjusting teammate settings and navigating the web console while being logged in as a teammate. Only a subset of users and their teammates were impacted with the aforementioned errors. This incident did not impact mail send. The deployed fix and its results will be monitored for the next 30 minutes for stability.

Our engineering team is continuing to work towards a fix. At this time, users may continue to experience errors when signing in with teammate credentials, making edits to the settings for some teammates or navigating the SendGrid console with some teammates. These problems will only impact a subset of users who are utilizing teammates. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Having identified the issue, our engineering team are continuing to work towards a fix. As of now, users may continue to experience errors when signing in with teammate credentials or making edits to settings for existing teammates. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. At this time users may continue to experience errors when signing in with teammate credentials or making edits to settings for existing teammates. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 11:40 AM PDT on August 1st, our engineers began investigating an issue with teammate management and teammate sign in. Users may experience errors when signing in with teammate credentials or making edits to settings for existing teammates. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SendGrid Plan Changes Unavailable and Payment Errors

incident_updates.body: The billing functionality has been confirmed as properly restored to the SendGrid platform. Restoration of the SendGrid billing functionality took place at approximately 1:30 PM PDT. All services are now operating normally at this time.

In reviewing the stability of the SendGrid platform billing functionality, our team determined that the billing system is showing signs of significant improvement. However, the stability of the system will continue to be monitored until this issue is confirmed to be resolved. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

As of 1:27 PM PDT, the third party involved in this incident has notified that a deployment has been made and it was stated that there is a noted recovery in performance to the billing functionality of downstream impacted systems (Twilio SendGrid). While this recovery should include the SendGrid platform and its billing function, we will continue to investigate the functionality of the SendGrid platform specifically as it relates to provider changes. Until this issue is confirmed as resolved, please be aware that there may still be degraded and intermittent inabilities to change plans (upgrade or downgrade), process a payment or make other billing-related changes within the SendGrid user interface. This incident does not directly impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Due to a third party provider incident, the SendGrid platform is experiencing an issue in billing functionality as of 12:03 PM PDT. Users may experience inability to upgrade or downgrade plans, and cannot access the billing page via the user interface. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Legacy Marketing Campaigns Displays Incorrect Information when Impersonating a Subuser

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Legacy Marketing Campaigns when impersonating a Subuser has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 12:50 PM Pacific Time on July 18th, 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with Legacy Marketing campaigns when impersonating a Subuser. Users may experience incorrect information displaying when impersonating a subuser and accessing Legacy Marketing Campaigns. This includes, but is not limited to, contact counts, campaign statistics, and other information shown within the feature. This does not impact mail send. Legacy Marketing Campaigns displays correctly when logging in directly as a subuser. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
